thread.title: Ebo Andoh Deserves Stars Call Up
thread.title_full: Ebo Andoh Deserves Stars Call Up

title: Ebo Andoh Deserves Stars Call Up
text:
Sports News | 21 October 2015 14:12 CET Ebo Andoh Deserves Stars Call Up By Daily Guide Andoh, tearing away from his marker 
If there is any player who has shown consistency in form and demonstrated readiness to advance the cause of the Black Stars in recent months, then it is Enoch Ebo Andoh. 
Currently playing for Port Vale in the English League One, the winger has been in great form in the last few weeks, crowning his superlative efforts with his debut goal for his side in their 1-1 drawn game with Peterborough United. 
Having featured for all the junior national teams as well as the local Black Stars, he has matured over the years, and appears ready for use should the technical handlers of the senior national soccer side extend him an invitation. 
The 22-year-old former King Faisal man was on target for the National Olympic team, the Black Meteors, in their game against Congo in an Olympic qualifier in Accra. 
He signed an 18-month contract with the English lower tier side in 2014 after impressing in their pre-season campaign. 
Premiership side Tottenham Hotspur have expressed interest in securing his services for a fee of Â£2.5 million in the January transfer window. 
By Kofi Owusu Aduonum
